page.title: 15Rydon School
page.content: There are 370 pupils in Rydon between the ages of 10 and 13, most of whom come from the primary schools in West Chiltington, Ashington, Amberley, Washington, Storrington and Thakeham. During their first year the children spend half of each week with their form teacher for English, History, Geography and Mathematics lessons. Science, French, Craft Design Technology, P.E.,Music and Religious Education are taught by specialist teachers. There are 19 teaching staff plus the Headmaster, welfare assistant, laboratory technician and secretary. School begins at 8.35 and finishes at 3.20. The day is divided into 8 lessons of 35 minutes each. During the lunch hour numerous activities take place (that was before the Union action interceded!)
